answers.question: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.

answers.answer: We built an an open source grants platform that includes an onchain voting and messaging protocol.  Our platform is designed to help DAOs give better grants. We ran a 90K ARB pilot round and funded web3 games in a decentralized manner. We are currently building the meta-governance for GG23 Community Rounds, helping creating a feedback loop to improve round quality over time.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
We introduce competition to the grants programs space - an alternative to monolithic, centralized grants council holding all the power. Competing grant allocators that perform well, as judged by community token-weighted votes, metric reviews and/or judge review, are rewarded with additional funds to distribute in future rounds.  

This flips the script, making grant allocators the customer who is seeking high quality teams to fund so that they survive and thrive in the next round.
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer: We will complete our buildout for GG23 and then look to GG24 and GG25 upgrades.  We are hoping to implement Grant Ships for some L2s, piping sequencer fees directly into the funding mechanism and letting ships compete to bring new users to a chain. We'll be using funds to support our build and operations as we seek new ecosystems who want to blast off with us.
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]â€”for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Grant Ships
project.description:
### What is Grant Ships?
It is an onchain, competitive/gamified grants platform on Arbitrum. 

### Where did it come from? 
Grant Ships was made possible through a grant from Arbitrum Foundation via Plurality Labs & Thrive. 

It is being developed by [The DAO Masons](https://www.x.com/daomasons).

Grant Ships has since received a followup grant through the Thank Arb Firestarters program and is being used as the meta-governance layer for [Gitcoin Grants 23](https://gg23.grantships.com). 

### How does it work? 

Multiple 'Ship Operator' teams compete to best allocate their portion of a grant fund. After the grants are distributed and outcomes are recorded, the community votes through a specialized TCR on who gave the most effective grants. Those ships are rewarded with additional funds for the following round. 

### Why does it work?
Grant Ships is built on the premise that explicit and visible competition, accountability and selection pressure on grants programs will force them to mature into something that is both effective and aligned with the desires of the DAO.

### How did the pilot go?
A detailed, graphical breakdown where we grade our performance on each of these 4 aspects of the Flywheel is available in our [Pilot Restrospective PDF](https://grantships.fun/pilotretro.pdf) - it is worth a scroll. 

## Video Overviews:

### Grant Ships Pilot Overview
[![Grant Ships Pilot Overview](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJoFf8Nxyl.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0qsoUrpjchA)

### Feature Spotlight: Dual-token Voting & Badges:
[![Feature Spotlight: Dual-token Voting & Badges](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Sy5gQ8EgJl.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q9c2zpyYMJk)

### Feature Spotlight: Project Profiles and Grant Applications:
[![Feature Spotlight: Project Profiles and Grant Applications](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/ryGF7UNekx.png)](https://youtu.be/BGwaYuGV5yk)

### How Can Arbitrum Fund Web3 Gaming?:
[![How Can Arbitrum Fund Web3 Gaming](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/B1FAXUVx1g.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3LBnCFTLrrQ)

### Coming Up
We're building the Gitcoin implementation now. Custom features for this build include NFT-enabled judge votes via rubric and AI-enhanced community voting.
